step_data.thought:
I notice that I'm already on a page that shows projects filtered by the 'web-development' topic. This is evident from the URL 'http://127.0.0.1:8023/explore/projects/topics/web-development' and the heading 'web-development' that appears on the page. The page is currently showing projects that have this topic tag applied.

Looking at the current page, I can see that there's a 'Filter by name' search box with bid '236' which allows filtering projects by name, but I don't see an immediate way to add another topic tag as a filter.

Since the user wants to add a tag to filter projects by topic, and I'm already on a page filtered by 'web-development', I need to look for a way to add additional topic filters. However, I don't see any clear UI element for adding more topic tags as filters.

Let me check if there's any filter or tag selection interface on this page. I don't see a dedicated topic filter UI component, but I notice that under one of the projects, there's a 'Topics:' label followed by the 'web-development' tag. This suggests that projects can have multiple topics, but I don't see a way to add another topic filter at the page level.

Since I don't see a clear way to add another topic filter on this page, I should inform the user about the current limitations.
step_data.action: stop('I can see that you are already viewing projects filtered by the "web-development" topic. The GitLab interface currently doesn't appear to have a way to add multiple topic filters simultaneously. You can only view projects by one topic at a time. You can search for projects within this topic using the "Filter by name" search box, or you can navigate to a different topic page to see projects with that tag instead.')
